title: Pest Control | Ecology & Environment | Biology | FuseSchool

subtasks: Defining what a pest is
Recognizing examples of pests (e.g., slugs damaging lettuce)
Explaining the different types of pesticides (insecticides, fungicides, herbicides)
Describing the application methods of pesticides (industrial machinery vs. manual)
Analyzing the protective gear worn by applicators (considering pesticide toxicity)
Discussing the historical use and effects of DDT in pest control
Exploring evolutionary adaptations of pests to resist pesticides
Contrasting chemical control (pesticides) with biological control (e.g., ladybirds against aphids)
Evaluating potential ecological consequences of introducing biological controls
Considering the case study of the Hawaiian cane toad in Australia (oversight in pest management)
